abstract: Steven P. Jobs, who has cancer, made Apple one of the world’s most valuable companies. Timothy D. Cook will take over as chief executive.
snippet: Steven P. Jobs, who has cancer, made Apple one of the world’s most valuable companies. Timothy D. Cook will take over as chief executive.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Steven P. Jobs, whose insistent vision that he knew what consumers wanted made Apple one of the world’s most valuable and influential companies, is stepping down as chief executive, the company announced late Wednesday.

headline.main: Jobs Steps Down at Apple, Saying He Can’t Meet Duties
headline.print_headline: Jobs Steps Down. Saying He Cannot Meet His Duties

abstract: No immediate changes to Apple products will be discernible with Mr. Jobs’s departure, but questions may arise in the future.
snippet: No immediate changes to Apple products will be discernible with Mr. Jobs’s departure, but questions may arise in the future.
lead_paragraph: Steven P. Jobs, one of the most successful chief executives in corporate history, once said he never thought of himself as a manager, but as a leader. And his notion of leadership revolved around choosing the best people possible, encouraging them and creating an environment in which they could do great work.

headline.main: Without Its Master of Design, Apple Will Face Many Challenges
headline.print_headline: Without Its Master of Design, Apple Will Face Many Challenges

abstract: Steven P. Jobs co-founded Apple Computer 35 years ago.
snippet: Steven P. Jobs co-founded Apple Computer 35 years ago.
lead_paragraph: Steven P. Jobs co-founded Apple Computer 35 years ago.

abstract: Warren Buffett’s investment in Bank of America was unable to turn the market around in the face of rising jobless claims.
snippet: Warren Buffett’s investment in Bank of America was unable to turn the market around in the face of rising jobless claims.
lead_paragraph: Traders have been overwhelmed by the prospects of a global economic slowdown, a euro zone debt problem and other issues. On Thursday, there were new developments to contend with: the resignation of Steven P. Jobs as chief executive of Apple and the investment by Berkshire Hathaway, which is run by Warren E. Buffett, in Bank of America.

headline.main: Shares Fall as Hopes Fade for New Action by Fed and Jobless Claims Rise
headline.print_headline: Shares Fall as Hopes Fade for New Action by Fed and Jobless Claims Rise

abstract: Apple said that Steven P. Jobs, its co-founder and chief executive, would step down, but wants to remain chairman. Tim Cook, the chief operating officer, will take over the position.
snippet: Apple said that Steven P. Jobs, its co-founder and chief executive, would step down, but wants to remain chairman. Tim Cook, the chief operating officer, will take over the position.
lead_paragraph: Apple said that Steven P. Jobs, its co-founder and chief executive, would step down, but wants to remain chairman. Tim Cook, the chief operating officer, will take over the position.

headline.main: Steven P. Jobs Leaves Chief Executive Role at Apple

abstract: The patents that carry Steven Jobs’s name help reveal a chief executive whose design choices reached into every corner of the company.
snippet: The patents that carry Steven Jobs’s name help reveal a chief executive whose design choices reached into every corner of the company.
lead_paragraph: When people in the technology industry speak of Steven P. Jobs’s knack for design, they often have Apple’s iconic products in mind: the early all-in-one Macintosh computers, the first iMacs with their brightly colored and translucent cases, and more recently, the various iPods, iPhones and iPads.

headline.main: A Chief Executive’s Attention to Detail, Noted in 313 Patents
headline.print_headline: A Chief Executive’s Attention to Detail, Noted in 313 Patents

byline.original: By Miguel Helft and Shan Carter

abstract: Many hedge fund managers count the technology giant among their top stock holdings — and it has paid off.
snippet: Many hedge fund managers count the technology giant among their top stock holdings — and it has paid off.

headline.main: Will Apple Remain a Hedge Fund Favorite?

abstract: The news that Steven Jobs would would step down as chief executive of Apple is being noted by senior agency managers as they assess the effect that his departure will have on the company’s brand.
snippet: The news that Steven Jobs would would step down as chief executive of Apple is being noted by senior agency managers as they assess the effect that his departure will have on the company’s brand.
lead_paragraph: The news that Steven P. Jobs would step down as chief executive of Apple has generated an outpouring of comments from senior managers of agencies about his decades at the helm of the company as well as what might come next there.

headline.main: On Madison Avenue, Talk of Jobs’s Legacy
